alert.note: Alert for Merrimack; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sullivan, south central Grafton and northwestern Merrimack Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Enfield, or 8 miles northwest of New London, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New London, Grafton, Enfield, Canaan, Danbury, Bristol, Grantham, Andover, Alexandria, Hill, Bridgewater, Croydon, Hebron, Wilmot, Springfield, Orange, Sunapee, and Plainfield. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 36 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern and central New Hampshire.
